meanings.definition: The state or quality of being tense.
meanings.sent1: The tensity in the room was palpable as everyone waited for the results.
meanings.sent2: Her muscles were tight with tensity as she prepared for the race.
meanings.sent3: The tensity in the air was so thick, you could almost cut it with a knife!
meanings.sent4: The tensity in the atmosphere mirrored the brewing storm outside.
meanings.sent5: The tensity in his voice revealed his nervousness to everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: The degree of tension or strain in a body or material.
meanings.sent1: The tensity of the rope was tested as the weight was gradually increased.
meanings.sent2: The tensity of the metal beam was crucial for the stability of the structure.
meanings.sent3: The tensity of the rubber band was no match for the weight of the books.
meanings.sent4: The tensity of the situation was like a coiled spring ready to snap.
meanings.sent5: The tensity of the fabric determined its durability under stress.
